channel.title: [PI]Slayer Item Needed[PI]
channel.description:
How do I make it so you need to wear a certain item to attack a certain npc?
Examples:
Facemask for Dust Devils Earmuffs for Banshees Leafbladed Sword/Spear for Turoths Mirror Shield for Cockatrice/Basilisks Etc.

item.title: [PI]Slayer Item Needed[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

Not fully understanding >.>
Don’t know exactly what an integer array is.

Can you show me the syntax of how an item would be put into it?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Slayer Item Needed[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

No errors and no spam, but that was with empty code.

I added:

case 1612: equipmentNeeded[c.playerHat] = 4166; break;
To:

And:

case 1612: //NPC <500> itemNeeded = 4166; //Item <565> is needed break;
To:

And I got:

src\server\model\players\skills\Slayer.java:91: incompatible types found : int :( required: int[] itemNeeded = 4166; //Item <565> is needed ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

So close

EDIT: I did also replace those 3 with what you gave me.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Slayer Item Needed[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Then it’d probably be best to use an array;

http://pastebin.com/R5jgxWZ3[/quote]
Dear Vain, I did not update my server til’ this morning, because I added it last night and there was a lot of activities occurring on my server. It was quiet in the morning, so I did it.
I was gone all day, and came back.
It turns out adding that slayer system spams the public chat of blank messages?
I re-uploaded my backup’d ClickNPC, Slayer, and NPCHandler classes, and it went away. I do not know what caused it, but it was definately the Slayer add-on…Any solution…?
For detailed conversation, please add my MSN at tormentedconnor@live.com

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Slayer Item Needed[PI]
item.dc:creator: @emtrescue emtrescue
item.description:
@emtrescue wrote:

open combatAssistant, and add these in anywhere

public boolean SLAYERMONSTER(int i) { switch (Server.npcHandler.npcs[i].npcType) { case MONSTERID: return true; } return false; }

look for

in the attacknpc method, and add this in anywhere in that method

			[code]if (SLAYERMONSTER(i) &&c.getItems().playerHasItem(itemid, 1)){
			else if (SLAYERMONSTER(i)){

				resetPlayerAttack();
				c.sendMessage("Your attacks have no effect without ITEMNAME HERE");
				return;
			}[/code]

this was handwritten and im a messy writter put that in consideration while adding this

slayer monster = monsters name
itemid = what item
monsterid = monsters id

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Slayer Item Needed[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

What if I wanted to allow more than one item needed? Because I have a Slayer Helmet on my server which of course is a combination of most slayer items.

case 500: //NPC <500>
    itemNeeded = 565 || itemNeeded = 13263; //Item <565> is needed/13263 = Slayer Helm
    break;

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Slayer Item Needed[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

Hey Vain, I could not figure out the way to put it. But,

In the checkSlayerRequirements, I put

case 1612: equipmentNeeded[c.playerHat] = 4166; break;
and that works fine.

But the second method, I keep getting

src\server\model\players\skills\Slayer.java:77: incompatible types found : int required: java.lang.String return itemNeeded = 4166; ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 1 error Press any key to continue . . .
For:

case 1612: return itemNeeded = 4166;
In the slayerRequirements method. Can you tell me the correct syntax with random item ID and npc ID please?

Thank you very much.

Read full topic

Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .

Never seen that type of error before, etiher…

item.title: [PI]Slayer Item Needed[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols

item.title: [PI]Slayer Item Needed[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

A friend of mine fixed my orphan case. Here are my errors, and I’ll pastebin my classes.

src\server\model\players\skills\Slayer.java:48: cannot find symbol symbol : variable equipment location: class server.model.players.skills.Slayer for (int i = 0; i < equipment.length; i++) { ^ src\server\model\players\skills\Slayer.java:64: cannot find symbol symbol : variable NPC_ID location: class server.model.players.skills.Slayer case NPC_ID: ^ src\server\model\players\skills\Slayer.java:65: cannot find symbol symbol : variable ITEM_ID location: class server.model.players.skills.Slayer return itemNeeded = ITEM_ID; ^ src\server\model\players\skills\Slayer.java:65: incompatible types found : int required: java.lang.String return itemNeeded = ITEM_ID; ^ src\server\model\players\skills\Slayer.java:69: missing return value return; ^ src\server\model\npcs\NPCHandler.java:2034: non-static method checkSlayerRequire ments(int) cannot be referenced from a static context if (Slayer.checkSlayerRequirements(i)) { ^ src\server\model\npcs\NPCHandler.java:2037: cannot find symbol symbol : method slayerRequirement(int) location: class server.model.players.skills.Slayer c.sendMessage(Slayer.slayerRequirement(i)); ^ src\server\model\players\packets\ClickNPC.java:100: non-static method checkSlaye rRequirements(int) cannot be referenced from a static context if (Slayer.checkSlayerRequirements(c.npcIndex)) { ^ src\server\model\players\packets\ClickNPC.java:104: cannot find symbol symbol : method slayerRequirement(int) location: class server.model.players.skills.Slayer c.sendMessage(Slayer.slayerRequirement(c.npcIndex)); ^ src\server\model\players\packets\ClickNPC.java:165: non-static method checkSlaye rRequirements(int) cannot be referenced from a static context if (Slayer.checkSlayerRequirements(c.npcIndex)) { ^ src\server\model\players\packets\ClickNPC.java:169: cannot find symbol symbol : method slayerRequirement(int) location: class server.model.players.skills.Slayer c.sendMessage(Slayer.slayerRequirement(c.npcIndex)); ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 11 errors Press any key to continue . . .

Slayer Class:
http://pastebin.com/dpGTsxSh

NPCHandler Class:
http://pastebin.com/mpYnQrME

ClickNPC Class:
http://pastebin.com/V3nFVUrk

The main reason why I need help is because I have never seen some of these errors before.

non-static method checkSlaye rRequirements(int) cannot be referenced from a static context

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Slayer Item Needed[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

src\server\models\players\packets\ClickNPC.java:171: Orphaned Case case FIRST_CLICK: ^

[code] if (c.attackTimer <= 0) {
if (Slayer.checkSlayerRequirements(c.npcIndex)) {
c.getCombat().attackNpc(c.npcIndex);
c.attackTimer++;
} else {
c.sendMessage(Slayer.slayerRequirement(c.npcIndex));
return;
}
}
break;

		case FIRST_CLICK:
			c.npcClickIndex = c.inStream.readSignedWordBigEndian();
			c.npcType = Server.npcHandler.npcs[c.npcClickIndex].npcType;
			if(c.goodDistance(Server.npcHandler.npcs[c.npcClickIndex].getX(), Server.npcHandler.npcs[c.npcClickIndex].getY(), c.getX(), c.getY(), 1)) {
				c.turnPlayerTo(Server.npcHandler.npcs[c.npcClickIndex].getX(), Server.npcHandler.npcs[c.npcClickIndex].getY());
				Server.npcHandler.npcs[c.npcClickIndex].facePlayer(c.playerId);
				c.getActions().firstClickNpc(c.npcType);	
			} else {
				c.clickNpcType = 1;
			}
			break;[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Slayer Item Needed[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

The Wanderer:

In RuneScape it isn’t required to wear those items, just when you attack them without those items it lowers your stats. Like for Cockatrices I believe it lowers your defence, attack, strength, and hitpoints to 10.

I understand, but I would like to have the requirement of wearing them, as I find it simpler.

Read full topic
